items.content_html:
Summary

Update hyphens.json to indicate that Czech/Slovak hyphenation patterns are added in Firefox 130.

Related issues

See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1908931 for the Firefox bug where this change landed.
items.title: Update CSS `hyphens: auto` language support

items.content_html:
length is listed in the IDL

  • https://svgwg.org/svg2-draft/types.html#InterfaceSVGStringList
  • https://svgwg.org/svg2-draft/coords.html#InterfaceSVGTransformList
items.title: Mark SVG{String,Transform}List.length as standardized

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR fixes #23840

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: deprecate webkit meter bar

items.content_html:
Add browser compatibility data for the CSS reading-flow property.

  • Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-display-4/#reading-flow
  • More info: https://developer.chrome.com/blog/reading-flow-display-contents?hl=en
  • Chrome 128 support: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113638848561152
items.title: feat(css): Add CSS Display Module Level 4 `reading-flow` property compatibility data

items.content_html:
FF129 supports signature algorithm Ed25519 in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1804788

This adds FF info for Ed25519. It also duplicates the ED25519 info for the SubtleCrypto.wrapKey/unwrapKey methods which should also support this algorithm, and does according to the tests https://wpt.fyi/results/WebCryptoAPI/wrapKey_unwrapKey/wrapKey_unwrapKey.https.any.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned

Further, the X25519 key agreement algorithm appears to also be implemented in same versions as Ed25519 in the platforms other than FF (according to their docs). This makes sense because they use the same curves. You can also see they are supported in various tests, including those for wrapKey/unwrapKey listed above.

So I have also created separate features to record support for this - it is used in a different subset of methods, and
FF X25519 support will not be implemented until https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1904836

Related docs can be tracked in mdn/content#34708
items.title: FF129 SubtleCrypto ED25519 support

items.content_html:
Notification.requestPermission() originally had a callback, but that is deprecated and it returns a promise. This updates the versions in which promise support was added. Chrome and FF tested in Browserstack. Safari information comes from the existing parent feature.

This is related to fixes for mdn/content#34945
items.title: Notification.requestPermission() - add version for returning Promise

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the update member of the windows Web Extensions interface. This sets the feature(s) to a version range based upon the date that the feature was added to BCD with the intent of replacing true values with ranged values to eliminate true values from BCD.

Commit/PR Adding the Feature: #262, #307
items.title: Update Chromium data for webextensions.api.windows.update
